name: Hair Density Boosting Scalp Serum for Thinning Hair & Hair Loss
categories: Hair, Hair Styling & Treatments, Hair Thinning & Hair Loss
about: What it is: A weightless leave-in scalp serum shown to promote meaningful hair growth in as little as 8 weeks and visibly reduce shedding by 2X for fuller, thicker hair...Hair Texture: Straight, Wavy, Curly, and Coily..Hair Type: Fine, Medium, and Thick..Hair Concerns:- Anti-Aging.- Thinning.- Color Safe..Key Benefits: - Visibly improves hair density.- Addresses fallout.- Has a lightweight texture with a nongreasy feel..Highlighted Ingredients:- Turmeric Stem Cells: Help reset the hair bulb for fuller-, thicker-looking hair..- Vegan Collagen: Increases hydration by 20X..- Ashwagandha: Strengthens roots and alleviates scalp irritation...Ingredient Callouts: Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance. It is also gluten-free and cruelty-free...What Else You Need to Know: Perfect for daily use, this lightweight gel serum absorbs into the scalp without disrupting your style. Turmeric stem cells initiate an epigenetic reset of the hair follicles while vegan collagen supports the growth cycle for visibly fuller, thicker, stronger hair. With consistent use, this treatment is clinically shown to promote the look of hair growth in as little as 8 weeks...This product is vegan, clean, color safe, and safe for use while pregnant or nursing..Fragrance Description: Crisp grapefruit top notes blend with a floral heart of jasmine and rose in a natural fragrance balanced by warm musk and sandalwood for a refreshing and grounding experience...Clinical Results: In a 16-week consumer study with 35 participants with thinning hair (types 1 to 4), after 8 weeks:.- 9 out of 10 subjects experienced meaningful new hair growth.- 97% saw healthier, fuller hair.- 94% experienced a reduction in hair shedding/loss...CLEAN at Sephora is our commitment to offering formulas that go beyond regulatory standards to avoid controversial ingredients without sacrificing on effectiveness.
ingredients: -Turmeric Stem Cells: Help reset the hair bulb for fuller-, thicker-looking hair..-Vegan Collagen: Increases hydration by 20X..-Ashwagandha: Strengthens roots and alleviates scalp irritation....Water/Aqua/Eau, Propanediol, Glycerin, Curcuma Longa (Turmeric) Root Extract, Withania Somnifera (Ashwagandha) Root Extract, Sr-Hydrozoan Polypeptide-1, Bacopa Monnieri Extract, Camellia Sinensis(Green Tea) Leaf Extract, Zingiber Officinale (Ginger) RootExtract, Larix Europaea Wood Extract, Biotin, Sodium Hyaluronate, Zinc Chloride, Ascorbic Acid, Arginine Levulinate, Glycine, Butylene Glycol, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Pentylene Glycol, Xanthan Gum, Sodium Metabisulfite, Phytic Acid, Tetrasodium Glutamate Diacetate, Potassium Sorbate, Sodium Hydroxide,1,2-Hexanediol, Caprylyl Glycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Citric Acid, Phenoxyethanol, Fragrance*, Iron Oxides (CI 77491), Iron Oxides (CI 77492), Benzyl Salicylate, Citronellol, Hexyl Cinnamal, Limonene....*Naturally derived....The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:..-Apply a few drops directly to your scalp, along the hairline, widening part, and/or other areas of concern..-Massage gently..-Wait a few minutes for the product to absorb..-Do not rinse..-Style as usual..-Use daily on a damp or dry scalp.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: While I didn't have any negative side effects like burning on breaking out as some other reviews mention, this also didn't do anything for my hair. Frankly, I don't think there's enough evidence that these ingredients could help hair growth, unless perhaps they are injected or microneedling is also done. Consumers should also be skeptical of reviews that say they saw results after a few weeks. As a reminder, hair grows roughly half an inch a month. If someone is seeing good results after a month, that would basically imply that this product is so good that it rebooted inactive hairs into a growth cycle on the first day of use. The gold standard of topical treatments, minoxidil, takes at LEAST two months to see initial results. There is no way this could be faster. So test it out if you are interested, and give it a good long trial run, but don't be swayed by someone who supposedly saw regrowth in two weeks.

reviews.review_title: I wanted to like this, but...
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've used plenty of hair oil treatments and loved the reviews on this one. But after using it for a few days, I'll most likely be sending it back.  1st issue: it BURNS. Normally, hair oil for me tingles and activates my scalp. Scalp stimulants tend to do that. But this one burns so bad, and any hair product I use (as much as 12 hours later) makes it worse. My scalp is 100% red, I look like I have a sunburn.   2nd issue: The smell is too strong. I think it's the tumeric, it's just too much to smell while sleeping  3rd issue: The price. I have two other hair oil brands that seem to perform better than this, and they're both under $18.   4th issue: The dropper. The glass dropper does not hold onto the liquid well, at the bottom. So if you don't time it right, you will drop some in your eye  5th issue: it burns in the shower. My routine is usually using the hair oil hours before bed, then I take a shower before bed. But yesterday, as a test, I tried not taking a shower after applying. I took a shower this morning, and any product I use is burning my scalp. The warm water also burns. This isn't normal for me  I wanted to like this one, but unfortunately M**lle rosemary mint oil and K**tsch scalp oil perform better than this brand

reviews.review_text: Where do I begin with this life-changing product? The formula is not only effective but also gentle on the scalp, which was a huge relief for me as someone with sensitive skin. Unlike other treatments I've tried in the past, this one doesn't leave behind any greasy residue or weigh my hair down. Instead, it absorbs quickly and leaves my hair feeling soft, silky, and incredibly manageable. What truly sets this treatment apart is its ability to target the root cause of hair loss and stimulate new growth. With consistent use, I've noticed a dramatic reduction in shedding, and my hairline has started to fill in where it was once sparse. I finally feel confident leaving the house without worrying about my hair looking thin or patchy. Not only has this treatment transformed my hair, but it has also boosted my confidence and self-esteem. I can't recommend it highly enough to anyone struggling with hair loss or thinning hair. It's worth every penny and then some!

reviews.review_text: Why do all the reviews for this look like they were written by the same person? First the 'incentivized' ones, and now the non-incentivized too! Hmmm. As for the product itself: the ingredients are GOOD, there is no denying that Ginger and Turmeric do have excellent scalp/hair benefits (at least in my experience) but the delivery system for these ingredients isn't the best. In trying to hydrate the hair - which naturally gives it more volume and the 'illusion' of thicker hair, the formulation itself ends up making my hair greasy, lank and just an overall mess! This is accentuated when my hair/scalp is damp, so I switched to only using on dry scalp, with limited success. On top of that, the instructions call for daily use, and it just starts to become too heavy. It makes no difference how sparingly I use the serum either. I'll try to use up what's left, maybe on alternate days, but I won't be repurchasing.   ~ My Sephora Top 7 must-have list ~  (My top 7 must-have beauty products of all time, focusing mainly on my purchases at Sephora)  1. reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: DISCLAIMER: I was gifted by Aavrani their Hair Density Boosting Treatment for Thinning Hair & Hair Loss in exchange for my honest review.   I was excited to try this product because it seem innovative and I love that it is full of natural ingredients to improve hair volume.   BASELINE:  I have fine and thin hair, I couldn’t keep my hair longer past my shoulders because I notice more hair loss if my hair is longer than that. I use box dyes to color my hair too and have oily scalp that has occasional dandruff when I have my period or I come across a new product that doesn’t work for me (e.g. dry shampoo, conditioner, shampoo, etc.)   TESTING TIMELINE: I was able to test the product for almost 4 weeks now. I am using and continuously using it up today. The bottle is almost half full, using the product on my hairline along my bangs area because that is the most evident part of my head where I notice less hair density. As the instruction says, I put a dropper- full of the product daily on my scalp and massage until absorbed.   MY REVIEW: Pros: -Non- sticky and non- oily. I like the thicker watery serum- like texture of the product. Easily absorbs even if I apply it on my dry scalp on no- wash days. It absorbs quicker though when hair is wet and scalp is cleaner. I like the scent of the product which is like a very mild herbal scent. Initially, I thought that it had no scent. But upon massaging it on my scalp, I can catch a whiff which is very mild and non- offensive. It also dissipated upon absorption into the scalp. It didn’t irritate my scalp and there was no dandruff experienced too. After a week or two, I noticed quicker growth on the site where I applied the product. Almost half inch of my natural color was already showing even just after three weeks of use.  MY RATING: 5/5  I like my experience of using it so far and it is significantly effective in making my hair grow quicker. I will continue using it and cannot wait to witness the significant benefits on my hair.

I have extremely thin and thinning hair so it will take time before I can get my hair back to where it was a year ago (and even then it was still very thinned out).  I will keep using this though.
